intro: Colymbada apiculata, commonly known as the apiculate colymbada, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and distinctive, palmate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. Its fruits are elongated, cylindrical berries that contain multiple seeds. Colymbada apiculata is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
